sen.j: 栗野 慎一郎（くりの しんいちろう、嘉永4年11月7日 (旧暦)（1851年11月29日） - 昭和12年（1937年）11月15日）は明治、大正期の日本国の外交官。
sen.e: Shinichiro KURINO (栗野 慎一郎, November 29, 1851 - November 15, 1937) was a Japanese diplomat in the Meiji and Taisho eras.
Shinichiro KURINO (November 29, 1851 - November 15, 1937) was a Japanese diplomat in the Meiji and Taisho eras.
sen.cmt: 英訳文から日本語名を削除しました。
sen.e: Shinichiro KURINO (November 29, 1851 - November 15, 1937) was a Japanese diplomat in the Meiji and Taisho eras.

sen.j: 福岡藩槍術師範栗野小右衛門の長男として福岡県に生まれる。
sen.e: Shinichiro was born in Fukuoka Prefecture as an first son of Shoemon KURINO, Sojutsu Shihan (Grand master of the art of the spearmanship) of the Fukuoka Domain.
Shinichiro was born in Fukuoka Prefecture as the first son of Shoemon KURINO, Sojutsu Shihan (Grand master of the art of the spearmanship) of the Fukuoka Domain.

sen.e: Shinichiro was born in Fukuoka Prefecture as the first son of Shoemon KURINO, Sojutsu Shihan (Grand master of the art of the spearmanship) of the Fukuoka Domain.
He studied at Hanko (Domain school) Shuyukan.

sen.j: 福岡藩第11代藩主黒田長溥の命により藩費留学生としてハーバード大学を卒業。
sen.e: He graduated from Harvard University as an overseas student on a domain scholarship by order of Nagahiro KURODA, the eleventh lord of the Fukuoka Domain.
He graduated from Harvard University as an overseas student on a domain scholarship by the order of Nagahiro KURODA, the eleventh lord of the Fukuoka Domain.

sen.e: He graduated from Harvard University as an overseas student on a domain scholarship by the order of Nagahiro KURODA, the eleventh lord of the Fukuoka Domain.

sen.j: 外務省に入省し、取調局長、政務局長、駐米公使、駐伊公使、駐仏公使を経て、20世紀初頭、駐露公使として日露戦争直前まで外交交渉に尽力。
sen.e: He entered Ministry of Foreign Affairs, and after he held successively the posts such as Leader of Investigation Bureau, Leader of Government Affairs Bureau, the Minister to the U.S.A., the Minister to Italy, and the Minister to France, in the beginning of the twentieth century, he made every effort at diplomatic negotiations as Minister to Russia until immediately before the Russo-Japanese War.

sen.j: 1904年（明治37年）2月6日、小村寿太郎外務大臣 (日本)の命によりロシア政府に国交断絶の通告公文を提出した。
sen.e: On February 6, 1904, he handed in the official document to notify Russia Government of the extinction of the diplomatic relations by order of Minister of Foreign Affairs Jutaro KOMURA.
On February 6, 1904, he handed in the official document to notify Russia Government of the extinction of the diplomatic relations by the order of Minister of Foreign Affairs Jutaro KOMURA.

sen.j: その後、フランス公使館が大使館に昇格した1906年（明治39年）に初代駐フランス大使に任ぜられ、翌1907年日仏協約を締結する。
sen.e: After that, in 1906 when the Legation in France was promoted to the Embassy, he was appointed as the first Ambassador to France, and in the next year, 1907, he concluded the Contract between France and Japan

sen.j: 1932年（昭和7年）枢密顧問官に就任。
sen.e: In 1932, he assumed the post of Privy Councilor.

sen.j: 1937年（昭和12年）勲一等旭日桐花大綬章受章。
sen.e: In 1937, Kun-itto (Order of First Class), Kyokujitu-Toka Daijusho (Order of the Rising Sun with Paulownia Flower, Grand Cordon) was conferred on him.
